channel.title: Cancer on Five Minutes Reads
channel.description: Recent content in Cancer on Five Minutes Reads

item.title: Cockney Rebel singer Steve Harley dies at 73
item.description: Cockney Rebel singer Steve Harley dies at 73 His best known song was Make Me Smile which went to number one in the charts in 1975. The musician had still been touring until recently, but cancelled dates to have treatment for cancer. Harley lived on the Essex-Suffolk border with his wife Dorothy, with whom he had two children. Harley was born in south London in 1951 and formed Cockney Rebel in the early 1970s.

item.title: Sister's stem cells help woman fight leukaemia
item.description: Sister’s stem cells help woman fight leukaemia Lesley Calder was diagnosed with acute myeloid leukaemia in 2019. chemotherapy was unsuccessful and her only option was a stem cell transplant. Her three siblings came forward to be tested as stem cell donors. The chances of a sibling match are just 25% but Lesley was lucky. Max was called on to donate his stem cells to a stranger last summer. Only 3% of the UK population is signed up to the stem cell donor register.
